H0.text: the site of secretion of h + and cl -. Chief cells

H1.text: the site of secretion of h + and cl -. Mucous neck cells

H2.text: the site of secretion of h + and cl -. Goblet cells

H3.text: the site of secretion of h + and cl -. Parietal cells

A4.text: Parietal cells (also known as oxyntic cells) are epithelial cells in the stomach that secrete hydrochloric acid (HCl) and intrinsic factor.

A5.text: Potassium (K+) and chloride (Clâˆ’) ions diffuse into the canaliculi.
